isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3176 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcproc.title: TROUBLESHOOTING
svcproc.para: All 3176-powered vehicles have a yellow "Engine Warning" light located in the instrument cluster. Every time the key switch is turned to the ignition position, the warning lights should come on for approximately 10 seconds, then turn off. If the "Engine Warning" light remains on and flashes a code number, it is an indication that the ECM has detected a problem. Consult the Caterpillar 3176 manual furnished with the vehicle for further information.
To determine the fault codes, use the following procedure:

step1.para: Begin the procedure with the engine off.
Start and run engine at low idle for about 30 seconds.
Ignition key switch must be in the RUN position (not crank).

note.para: Caterpillar 3176 engine diagnostics must be performed with the engine RUNNING.

step1.para: Turn cruise ON/OFF switch to the OFF position.
Hold cruise SET/ACCEL - RESUME/COAST switch in the RESUME position for 2 seconds and then release.
Yellow "Engine Warning" light will flash first digit of fault code.
There will be a one to two second pause.
Yellow "Engine Warning" light will flash the second fault code digit.
There will be two to three seconds pause between fault codes if more than one fault code is present.

note.para: All Caterpillar fault codes are 2 digits.

step1.para: The second and all successive fault codes will flash until all codes have been shown.
To stop the diagnostics procedure, do nothing. To see the fault codes again, repeat steps 5 to 10.

svcproc.para: Digit 1 = 5. Then there will be a one to two second pause.

If a problem should occur with the 3176 system, use the Electronic Control Analyzer Programmer (ECAP), the Digital Diagnostic Tool (DDT), and the Caterpillar Service Manuals for further diagnostic procedures. The ECAP is available at the nearest Caterpillar Service Center.
The vehicle diagnostic connector (8-pin connector) can be utilized by the diagnostic tools to interface with the ECM by using an adapter cable available from Caterpillar dealers (Part Number 7X1403).

note.para: The ECAP and DDT must contain the new electrical memory chips for the 3176 engines. The PEEC memory chips will not work on the 3176 engine.
The ECAP service tool is sensitive to upper and lower case letters. Use "CAP LOCKS" to switch back and forth.
The DDT can do numerical passwords only. Vehicles with alphanumeric passwords must use the ECAP for programming.
